bwwExcerpt: Borle pulls off the rare feat of appearing simultaneously sexy and ridiculous as the Bard who rips off "Hamlet" from a Renaissance nobody named Nigel Bottom. As that timid genius, John Cariani makes adorable totally arresting when he puts up the good fight not to turn his masterpiece into a musical called "Omelette," which pits him against his very determined, very dense producer-brother, Nick Bottom (Brian d'Arcy James)...when two or all three of them converge, it's musical nirvana.
